Maths

Class EuclideanKNN

  • java.lang.Object
    • Maths.kNN
      • Maths.EuclideanKNN

  • public class EuclideanKNN
extends kNN
    Maths.EuclideanKNN extends the Maths.kNN abstract method and uses an euclidean distance metric for the calculations. The formula is [distance] = sqrt(sum((endPoint - origin) ^ 2)) where the sum adds the values for every dimension.
    Version:
    Milestone 3
    Author:
    Darren

      Iterates through all of the sub cells in a DataModel.CompositeCell and calculates the distance from that DataModel.CompositeCell to the target point's corresponding DataModel.CompositeCell.
      Cell findKNN(java.lang.String targetKey, Point targetPoint, int neighbours)
      findKNN finds the target value for the given point using an euclidean KNN algorithm with the k nearest points.

    • Method Detail

      • findKNN

        public Cell findKNN(java.lang.String targetKey,
                    Point targetPoint,
                    int neighbours)
        findKNN finds the target value for the given point using an euclidean KNN algorithm with the k nearest points. Calls the super class's findValue funtion once the nearest neighbours are found.
        Specified by:
        findKNN in class kNN
        Parameters:
        targetKey - The key to be found
        targetPoint - The point whose value is to be found
        neighbours - The number of nearest neighbours to query
        Returns:
        The unknown value of the given point

      • EuclideanComposite

        public float EuclideanComposite(CellComposite current,
                                CellComposite target)
        Iterates through all of the sub cells in a DataModel.CompositeCell and calculates the distance from that DataModel.CompositeCell to the target point's corresponding DataModel.CompositeCell.
        Parameters:
        current - The DataModel.CompositeCell of the non-target point
        target - The DataModel.CompositeCell of the target point
        Returns:
        The distance between the Cells
